intro: Tithymalopsis discoidalis, commonly known as the disc-shaped tithymal, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, similar to those of other members of the carrot family. Tithymalopsis discoidalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators.
